definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to emerge in large numbers/to spring up/to emerge prominently
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to well up/to boil out/to bubble forth/to spurt
to roll over and over (of billows or clouds)
in large numbers/in force/lit. clouds bubbling up
to well up/to spill out (of water from a spring)

sentences.english: The bus disgorged a crowd of noisy children.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽車上湧下來一羣嘰嘰喳喳的孩子。

sentences.english: Crowds poured in all the morning.
sentences.chinese: 整個上午，人們不斷湧進來。

sentences.english: In these patients, she says, it’s not enough to quell the acid sloshing up from the stomach.
sentences.chinese: 她表示，僅僅抑制胃酸從胃部上湧是不夠的。

sentences.english: The Man shut his eyes hard as the tears poured down his face.
sentences.chinese: 男人用力地閉上了眼睛，淚如泉湧。

sentences.english: Three fine streams of hot water spouted from holes in the radiator .
sentences.chinese: 三小股熱水從水箱外殼的洞裏湧出來。

sentences.english: Then, the wave catches the surfboard and pulls it and the surfer toward the shore.
sentences.chinese: 接著大浪會湧向滑板，將滑板與衝浪者推往海岸。

sentences.english: The mechanism of piping and piping failure in Jingjiang Dike foundation is studied.
sentences.chinese: 本文探討荊江大堤堤基管湧和管湧破壞的機理。

sentences.english: Finally those who hunt them must be punished severely.
sentences.chinese: 最後，對湧鋃獵珍稀野生動物的人必須嚴懲。

sentences.english: Andrew was not ashamed to find that tears were coursing down his face.
sentences.chinese: 安德魯淚如泉湧，卻並不爲之慚愧。

sentences.english: Curious sightseers rolled up in their hundreds.
sentences.chinese: 數以百計的好奇的觀光客都湧到那兒。

sentences.english: The imagined grief was so poignant that Bertha burst into tears.
sentences.chinese: 想象的悲慟是如此強烈，使伯莎淚如泉湧。

sentences.english: Between the breakers and shore, a lot of water goes in and goes out with a lot of force.
sentences.chinese: 在岸邊和碎浪之間，在強力的推動下，水湧來湧去。

sentences.english: As soon as the gates were opened, crowds of football supporters piled in.
sentences.chinese: 門一打開，成羣的爲足球賽吶喊助威的人湧了進來。

sentences.english: Frustrated workers fled to the Sunbelt to find work.
sentences.chinese: 失望的工人們湧向西部和西南部尋找工作。

sentences.english: The football match (being) over， crowds of people poured out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 足球賽五結束，從羣便湧到大街上。

sentences.english: It's all happening now in a bunch.
sentences.chinese: 但是，現在一下子湧上來了。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to miss/to long for/to remember with longing/yearning
to turn over/to surge/to churn/to rummage/raging (torrent)
